pages.content:
[HEADING] MSc Digital Transformation / Overview
[HEADING] Course options
[HEADING] Course overview
[HEADING] Open days
[HEADING] Fees
[HEADING] Policy on additional costs
[HEADING] Scholarships/sponsorships
[HEADING] Contact details
[HEADING] Courses in related subject areas
[HEADING] Regulated by the Office for Students
Attend an open day
Year of entry: 2025
We require a First or Upper Second class honours degree (2:1, with 60% average) from a UK university or the overseas equivalent.
When assessing your academic record, we take into account your grade average, position in class and the standing of the institution where you studied your qualification.
Full entry requirements
Apply online >>
Staged Admissions Deadlines
Applying to multiple programmes
Attend an open day
Be ahead of the curve in an ever-changing digital landscape.
Our MSc in Digital Transformation is a new, innovative programme designed to explore the multifaceted dimension of the digital revolution with the premise to develop future leaders with the expertise to navigate the evolving digital landscape successfully. On this programme you'll delve deep into the strategies, technologies, and organisational change dynamics required to thrive in an era defined by digital disruption.
The core course units at the heart of the programme will encompass a rich array of subject areas that form the foundational pillars by which a career in technology can be built upon. These include, Digital Strategy, Emerging Technologies, Data Strategy and Visualisation, and Change Management.
Our programme fosters a collaborative and innovative learning environment, allowing you to engage in experiential learning opportunities to apply your newfound knowledge and skills to solve complex business problems. Immersing you in real-world scenarios, you'll develop the practical insights and capabilities needed to drive meaningful change within organisations.
Register for a master’s event today, online and in person.
For  entry in the academic year beginning September 2025, the tuition fees are as follows:
Further information for EU students can be found on our dedicated EU page.
The fees quoted above will be fully inclusive for the course tuition, administration and computational costs during your studies.
All students should normally be able to complete their programme of study without incurring additional study costs over and above the tuition fee for that programme. Any unavoidable additional compulsory costs totalling more than 1% of the annual home undergraduate fee per annum, regardless of whether the programme in question is undergraduate or postgraduate taught, will be made clear to you at the point of application. Further information can be found in the University's Policy on additional costs incurred by students on undergraduate and postgraduate taught programmes (PDF document, 91KB).
Read more about available         scholarships and funding.
Use the links below to view lists of courses in related subject areas.
The University of Manchester is regulated by the Office for Students (OfS). The OfS aims to help students succeed in Higher Education by ensuring they receive excellent information and guidance, get high quality education that prepares them for the future and by protecting their interests. More information can be found at the OfS website.
You can find regulations and policies relating to student life at The University of Manchester, including our Degree Regulations and Complaints Procedure, on our regulations website.

• View full page
• MSc (full-time)UK students (per annum): £17,500
International, including EU, students (per annum): £31,500
• Alliance MBS Masters Scholarships for UK/EU/International students

[DEFINITION_LIST]
Degree awarded: Master of Science
Duration: 12 months
Entry requirements: We require a First or Upper Second class honours degree (2:1, with 60% average) from a UK university or the overseas equivalent.
When assessing your academic record, we take into account your grade average, position in class and the standing of the institution where you studied your qualification.

Full entry requirements
How to apply: Apply online >>     Staged Admissions Deadlines     Applying to multiple programmes
[DEFINITION_LIST]
School/Faculty: Alliance Manchester Business School
School/Faculty: Alliance Manchester Business School was established in 1965 as one of the UK's first two business schools. Today, we are the UK's largest campus-based business and management school, and 'Original Thinking Applied' is at the heart of everything we do.       Find out more
.

[HEADING] Taught master's study at Manchester
[HEADING] Meet us
[HEADING] Information sessions
[HEADING] Contact us
[HEADING] Study fairs and visits
[HEADING] International students
[HEADING] Why Manchester?
[HEADING] Award-winning Careers Service
[HEADING] Making a difference
[HEADING] Best UK city to live
[HEADING] Global reputation
[HEADING] A diverse community
Shape your future
Learn today, lead tomorrow
Join our one-hour information sessions with our UK and International Recruitment Teams.
Book a session
Have a question about master's study or an application you've submitted?
Get in touch with us
We attend study fairs and visits throughout the year, so you can meet us near you.
Find a study fair
Find entry requirements, contact details and country-specific events.
Learn more : international students
Award-winning Careers Service
2nd most targeted university by leading graduate employers.
(The Graduate Market in 2024, High Fliers Research)
Our graduates are among the most targeted by the UK's top graduate employers, giving you the best chance to get ahead in your future career.
Throughout your studies, and for two years after you graduate, you can access our award-winning Careers Service, which provides one-to-one tailored support and events to help you develop valuable skills.
Find out more about your employability opportunities and our Careers Service.
Making a difference
Number one in the UK and Europe and number two in the world for social and environmental impact.
(Times Higher Education Impact Rankings, 2025)
Social responsibility is one of our core goals and we are committed to creating a healthier, fairer and greener world through research, teaching and learning, and public engagement.
With us, you will have the opportunity to make an ethical, social, and environmental difference in society through student volunteering, online courses, and activities.
Read how you can get involved in socially responsible activities at Manchester.
Best UK city to live
Manchester is rated the top UK city to live in.
(The Economist Global Liveability Index, 2022)
The first of Britain's great modern cities, Manchester is a true original; a confident, creative, contemporary city that likes to do things differently.
The city, and surrounding Greater Manchester, offers an exciting mix of sport, entertainment, art and culture, shopping, and much more.
Discover Manchester.
Our global reputation
35th best university in the world.
(QS World University Rankings, 2026)
We are also the 11th best in Europe and the 7th best in the UK.
Our reputation is built on research and we have the credentials to match. You will benefit from our continuous investment in research facilities and master's courses that are led by distinguished tutors working at the forefront of their subjects.
Explore all our University rankings.
Inclusive and diverse community
We are home to more than 14,400 international students from outside the EU.
Each year, the quality of our teaching and research welcomes one of the largest international student populations in the UK to our University.
We welcome students from 160 countries each year from all over the world, creating a truly multicultural University with an exciting and friendly community.
Find out more about international study at Manchester.

pages.content:
[HEADING] Scholarships and Funding for Master's Degrees
[HEADING] Funding Opportunities for Master's Degrees
[HEADING] Master’s Scholarship Opportunities
[HEADING] Alliance Manchester Business School Scholarship
[HEADING] Scholarships for Accounting and Finance Programmes
[HEADING] University of Manchester Funding Opportunities
[HEADING] Humanities Postgraduate Scholarship
[HEADING] Manchester Alumni Loyalty Discount
[HEADING] Manchester Master's Bursary
[HEADING] Sports Scholarships
[HEADING] Talented Athlete Scholarship Scheme (TASS)
[HEADING] Equity and Merit Scholarship
[HEADING] Global Futures Scholarship
[HEADING] North American Foundation Awards
[HEADING] External Funding Opportunities
[HEADING] British Chevening Scholarship
[HEADING] GREAT Scholarship
[HEADING] BAFöG
[HEADING] Indonesia Endowment Fund for Education (LPDP)
[HEADING] Commonwealth Scholarships and Fellowships Plan (CSFP) General Scholarship
[HEADING] Fulbright Scholarships
[HEADING] Canada Centennial Scholarship Fund (CCSF)
[HEADING] US Marshall Scholarship
[HEADING] Postgraduate Solutions Study Bursaries
[HEADING] Take the next steps
Discover the Master's funding opportunities available to you
If you're looking for Master's degree funding, you should research your options as soon as possible. There is a range of support available with the postgraduate loan, bursaries and scholarships.
There are several master's funding options for our courses, and these will vary depending on whether you’re a student from the UK, EU or an international student from outside the EU.
Please note: if you are successful in receiving more than one scholarship award, the total scholarship amount must not exceed 50% of your course tuition fees.
Master's student loan for UK students
If you are a prospective master's student from the UK there are potential sources of funding available. The UK Government has confirmed that Postgraduate Loans will be offered to UK students starting a master's course in the 2025/26 academic year.
Learn more about funding for UK students
Value: Varies by recipient
We have several partial scholarships across all our courses.
All candidates who are offered a place on one of our master’s courses are considered for funding.
No additional application is required.
Decisions are made on merit rather than financial need. Scholarships are awarded if you:
Scholarships are awarded on a rolling basis throughout the admissions cycle. We have a limited number of scholarships. Awards are subject to availability and may not be available in the later stages.
We'll only contact you if you are successfully selected to receive a scholarship. Unfortunately, we can't offer scholarships to all eligible applicants.
Value: £10,000 Scholarship
All applicants who hold an offer will automatically be considered for a scholarship. Decisions are made on merit rather than financial need. There is no application needed.
Scholarships are available for all UK/EU applicants who hold an offer of a place to study on one of the following courses:
The value of the scholarships will go towards the cost of the full course tuition fee.
Value: £10,000
No separate application required – awards are granted on academic merit and strength of personal profile. Open to students from the UK, EU/EEA, India and USA.
Learn more about the Humanities Postgraduate Scholarship
Value: 10% discount on tuition fees
Offered to alumni of The University of Manchester enrolling on one of the Business School's taught master's courses.
Learn more about the Manchester Alumni Loyalty Discount
Value: £4,000 bursary
Supports students from underrepresented backgrounds in the UK to access postgraduate study at The University of Manchester.
Learn more about the Manchester Master’s Bursary
Value: Varies by recipient
Supports students from all countries balancing study with achieving their aspirations to continue moving up their sporting pathway.
Learn more about Sport Scholarships
Value: Varies by recipient
Supports talented athletes in education with performance sport experts and experienced practitioners.
Learn more about the TASS
Value: Full tuition
This scholarship is only valid for students studying MSc Human Resources Management and Industrial Relations.
For resident citizens of Ethiopia, Malawi, Rwanda, Tanzania, Uganda or Zimbabwe and have not previously studied outside of Africa.
Learn more about the Equity and Merit Scholarship
Value: £8,000 deducted from international tuition fee (£15,000 for listed African countries).
We're proud to offer awards totalling more than £4.5 million to international students starting their studies in September 2025.
Learn more about the Global Futures Scholarship
Value: £8,600 deducted from international tuition fee
Thanks to NAFUM and its generous supporters, students from the US, Greater Manchester and the Global South have all been able to gain a Manchester education.
Learn more about the North American Foundation Awards
Value: Fully funded Scholarship
These scholarships are for high calibre international students with the personal intellect and interpersonal qualities needed for leadership.
Learn more about Chevening Scholarships
Value: £10,000
GREAT Scholarships offer students from 18 countries the opportunity to have £10,000 towards their tuition fees
Learn more about the GREAT Scholarship
Value: Varies by recipient
German applicants can apply for BAföG funding in the form of a grant, subsidy, state or bank loan.
Learn more about BAföG funding
Value: Varies by Scholarship type
This fund is used to provide scholarships for Indonesian citizens pursuing higher education, both domestically and internationally.
Learn more about the LPDP
Award: Studentship
Value: Varies by recipient
Open to Commonwealth citizens, refugees or British protected persons permanently resident in any Commonwealth country other than the UK.
Learn more about the CSFP
Value: Varies by recipient
These scholarships are for applicants from the USA only. They include tuition and living expenses.
Learn more about Fulbright Scholarships
Value: £5,000 annually
Supports eligible Canadians studying for a postgraduate degree who have completed their first year of study.
Learn more about the CCSF
The Government of Canada also has scholarships available.
Learn more about Government of Canada scholarships
Value: Varies by recipient
United States citizens who (at the time they take up their Scholarship) hold a first degree from an accredited four-year college or university in the United States.
Learn more about the US Marshall Scholarship
Value: £2,000 Bursary
Every postgraduate student is eligible to apply for this funding, whatever their subject choice and whether they are studying full-time, part-time, online or via blended learning. Even if a student has secured other funding for their postgraduate programme, this can be topped up with one of the £2,000 bursaries.
Learn more about Postgraduate Solutions Study Bursaries
• MENU




CLOSE
• CLOSE
• Can demonstrate excellent academic performance
• Are on track to obtain, or who have graduated with a 2:1 or 1st UK undergraduate degree or overseas equivalent
• Have previously studied at a university with a strong academic reputation and ranking
• Have the potential to contribute and enrich all aspects of the master's programme and the diverse academic and cultural profile of the master's class.

pages.title: Business Masters Scholarships & Funding UK | Alliance MBS

pages.content:
[HEADING] Applying for a Master's degree
[HEADING] The application process for a Master's Degree
[HEADING] Staged admissions process
A step-by-step guide to the application process.
If you're considering applying for a Master's degree, you will need to check that you meet the Master's degree requirements. Applications for September entry open in October and you don't need to wait until you finish your studies to apply.
Applicants and offer-holders information and updates concerning coronavirus >>
Applications for September 2025 entry will open on 10 October 2024. You can apply before you complete your studies – make sure you include your latest transcripts with your supporting documents.
Follow the steps below to ensure the application process goes as smoothly as possible.
1. Check the academic and English language requirements >>
2. Prepare your supporting documents >>
3. Check if you need to pay an application fee
4. Apply online >>
The final decision on your application is made by the Alliance MBS Master's Admissions Office and a member of the team will contact you directly.
If you are made an offer, find out how to accept your place >>
As there is a high demand for our courses, we operate a staged admissions process with selection deadlines throughout the year. Due to the large number of high-quality applications we receive, we give preference to students from high-ranking institutions and with grades above our minimum entry requirements.
Please ensure that you submit all supporting documentation with your application before the application deadline to avoid delays in processing.
Please note: the final application deadline for the 2025/26 academic year is 1 July 2025.
Application received by:
Application update by:
7 December 2024
21 February 2025
2 March 2025
5 June 2025
1 July 2025
25 July 2025
Due to the competition for places on our programmes, we are not always able to provide you with a final decision on your application by the deadline date. In some instances, it may be necessary for us to roll your application forward to the next deadline date for further consideration.
Please note:  Due to the high demand for our courses, we are unable to guarantee that all applicants who meet our minimum entry requirements will receive an offer as unfortunately, we do not have enough spaces available on our programmes for all eligible students.
All places are subject to availability and if you apply at one of the later stages, some courses may already be reaching capacity. We recommend that you apply early in the cycle to avoid disappointment.
Applications received in our final stage, or after our application deadline, will be considered at the discretion of the Admissions Team if places are still available. If you apply after the final application deadline, there is no guarantee your application will be processed.
Apply before finishing your undergraduate degree
We can accept your application before you complete your studies. You need to submit your latest transcripts with your online application, together with the other supporting documents.
If you are applying for a finance-related course, you must include a list of your final year units.
Application fee
The following courses require a non-refundable application fee of £60:
You don't need to pay an application fee if the programme you are applying for is not listed.
How to pay the application fee
If you're applying for a programme that requires an application fee, you must pay it within the application portal before submitting your application. You can't submit your application without paying the application fee. Due to processing times, we cannot accept your payment via bank transfer.
If an agent is submitting an application on your behalf, they will have to pay the application fee. We can't provide a link for you to pay this separately.
You must pay an application fee for each programme that you wish to be considered for. Please read the information regarding our staged admissions process and deadlines carefully. All places are subject to availability and application fees are non-refundable.
If you have applied for a British Chevening Scholarship or Indonesia Endowment Fund for Education (LPDP) Scholarship, or are eligible for the Manchester Master's Bursary Scheme, you do not need to pay the application fee. However, you must submit evidence of your scholarship application.
Read more about Master's degree bursaries >>
Want to know more?
Help with your application
Supporting documents
Listen to the AMBSlife podcast
• MENU




CLOSE
• CLOSE
• MSc Accounting
• MSc Accounting and Finance
• MSc Business Analytics: Operational Research and Risk Analysis
• MSc Digital Marketing

Scholarship
Alliance Manchester Business School
A limited number of scholarships are available across all our Masters courses for September 2025 entry. This is a partial scholarship that will cover part of the tuition fee.
Scholarships will be awarded in line with our selection deadlines. Applicants who have been successfully awarded a scholarship will therefore be contacted on or before their selection deadline via email. If you have not received a scholarship award by your initial deadline, you may still be considered in the next selection round.
Please note only successful candidates will be contacted.
Continuation of the award is subject to satisfactory progress.
Alliance Manchester Business School, The University of Manchester

Note: students are automatically considered for the scholarship and there is no separate application process for it.
All UK/EU/International candidates who apply and are offered a place on one of our masters courses are considered for funding - there is no additional scholarship application required.

Decisions will be made on merit and not financial need. Scholarships will be awarded to applicants who:
Scholarships are awarded within each selection stage and will be announced on or before each decision deadline date. Please note that we will only contact you if you have been successfully selected to receive a scholarship.
Applicants who have been successfully awarded a scholarship will be contacted on or before their selection deadline via email. If you have not received a scholarship award by your initial deadline, you may still be considered in the next selection round.

[HEADING] Career opportunities
Attend an open day
Year of entry: 2025
Read about our Postgraduate Careers Service >>
Read the latest information on visa changes and opportunities in the UK for international students >>
Graduates may consider a career in a wide range of private, public, third sector and academic organisations. Roles would focus on management of teams that utilise modern digital methods to tackle challenges to business practices.
• View tabs
• View full page
pages.title: MSc Digital Transformation - careers (2025 entry) | The University of Manchester

pages.content:
[HEADING] MSc Digital Transformation / Course details
[HEADING] Course description
[HEADING] Aims
[HEADING] Special features
[HEADING] Teaching and learning
[HEADING] Course unit details
[HEADING] Course unit list
[HEADING] Disability support
Attend an open day
Year of entry: 2025
Our MSc in Digital Transformation is a new, innovative programme designed to explore the multifaceted dimension of the digital revolution with the premise to develop future leaders with the expertise to navigate the evolving digital landscape successfully. On this programme you'll delve deep into the strategies, technologies, and organisational change dynamics required to thrive in an era defined by digital disruption.
The core course units at the heart of the programme will encompass a rich array of subject areas that form the foundational pillars by which a career in technology can be built upon. These include, Digital Strategy, Emerging Technologies, Data Strategy and Visualisation, and Change Management.
Our programme fosters a collaborative and innovative learning environment, allowing you to engage in experiential learning opportunities to apply your newfound knowledge and skills to solve complex business problems. Immersing you in real-world scenarios, you'll develop the practical insights and capabilities needed to drive meaningful change within organisations.
Take one of two pathways, depending on your interests including our unique fintech pathway.
Gain an in-depth understanding of practice and theory in the areas of financial technology (fintech).
Take part in a year-long consultancy project that allows you to apply your studies to tackle real-world business challenges.
We adapt teaching practices to reflect the diverse ways in which students learn, by combining traditional lectures with more interactive workshops, self-learning, as well as various aspects of e-learning.
Across the whole programme, the teaching and learning methods are designed to help you develop a sufficiently broad range of transferrable skills, including:
Year-Long Consultancy Project (60 credits)
The course unit details given below are subject to change, and are the latest example of the curriculum available on this course of study.
• View tabs
• View full page
• Recognise and evaluate the role of leadership in driving and facilitating organisational change.
• Analyse the impact of digital technologies on various industries and sectors, including the implications for business models and the adoption of emerging technologies in diverse settings.
• Apply critical thinking and problem-solving skills to address challenges in digital strategy formulation and implementation within a collaborative team project.
• Design and implement digital strategies and initiatives to enhance organisational operations and supply chains.
• Utilise project management methodologies and tools to plan, monitor and deliver digital transformation projects.
• Regular group discussions to develop interpersonal oral communication skills
• Group projects to develop team-working skills
• Written assessments to develop written communication skills
• E-Learning incorporated into assessment to develop greater levels of confidence in managing your own learning and transferable digital skills
• Apply what you have learned in the taught part of the course to real-world consultancy projects.
• Acting as consultants, students will be required to work in groups to deliver a comprehensive solution to a complex case study.
• You’ll be working to develop a this project throughout the year.
[HTML_TABLE]
Title | Code | Credit rating | Mandatory/optional
Digital Strategy | BMAN74531 | 15 | Mandatory
Organising and Managing Change in the Digital Age | BMAN74541 | 15 | Mandatory
Core and Emerging Technologies | BMAN75421 | 15 | Mandatory
Data Strategy and Visualisation | BMAN75432 | 15 | Mandatory
Integrative Business Consultancy Project | BMAN75470 | 60 | Mandatory
Digitalisation of Operations and Supply Chains | BMAN75491 | 15 | Mandatory
Knowledge Management and Digital Strategy | BMAN71652 | 15 | Optional
Financial Data Analytics & AI in Finance | BMAN74222 | 15 | Optional
User Experience (UX) Design and Web Analytics | BMAN74822 | 15 | Optional
FinTech and the Global Economy | BMAN75442 | 15 | Optional
Open Finance and Payment Technologies | BMAN75452 | 15 | Optional
Decentralised Finance, Blockchain, and Web3 | BMAN75462 | 15 | Optional

Staged Admissions Deadlines
Applying to multiple programmes
Your statement of purpose should cover the areas outlined below:
We can only process applications with the following documents:
To defer your offer to the following year, you must contact your admission officer to get a copy of the deferral form. You can only defer your offer for one year.
If you applied in the previous year and your application was not successful you may apply again. Your application will be considered against the standard course entry criteria for that year of entry. In your new application you should demonstrate how your application has improved. We may draw upon all information from your previous applications or any previous registrations at the University as a student when assessing your suitability for your chosen course.
• View tabs
• View full page
• Tell us why you are interested in the MSc Digital Transformations course at Alliance MBS and how the course will impact on your future.
• Describe what makes you an outstanding applicant and describe your potential to contribute to all aspects of the course.
• valid English Language qualification
• first and second year transcript (scanned copies are accepted at the time of application)
• statement of purpose (this is included as part of your application form, you do not need to email your statement of purpose directly to the Admissions Team)

pages.content:
[HEADING] MSc Digital Transformation / Entry requirements
[HEADING] Academic entry qualification overview
Attend an open day
Year of entry: 2025
We require a First or Upper Second class honours degree (2:1, with 60% average) from a UK university or the overseas equivalent.
When assessing your academic record, we take into account your grade average, position in class and the standing of the institution where you studied your qualification.
• View tabs
• View full page

pages.content:
[HEADING] Master's courses at The University of Manchester
[HEADING] Course finder
You may already have a good idea of which master's course you wish to study – or you may be interested more generally in a particular subject area.
We can help you find the right master's course for you, regardless of what stage of the decision-making process you are at. You can browse our postgraduate taught courses using our course finder, or explore our full list of subject areas.
A-Z list of courses
The University of Manchester provides approved course information only to the following trusted sites: UCAS, Hotcourses, TARGETcourses, Prospects, Education UK, MastersPortal.eu, FindAMasters and MastersCompare. Information found on any other external site is not approved or supported by the University, and may not be current or reliable.
